Now what is the meaning of file I.O.

chunks.Title: Lecture_7
chunks.text: I.O. means input and output  in terms of files, now we all know that we have been making Python files till now, we must have seen different types of files  all the pictures we take, all the videos we have, all of them are stored in any file format in any system  now in the file I.O. means input output, it means we are opening a file, we are reading some data in it  we are doing some updates in it, we are writing some new data, we are closing that file, we are deleting that file  these types of different operations come under the category of file I.O.  so basically Python as a language can be used to perform operations on a file  for example, if there is a file saved on your computer, then we can perform operations on it  that means we can write such lines in our code, we can write such code that will access that file  can read the data in it, can write, can update, can append data in it and many more different operations

chunks.Title: Lecture_7
chunks.text: now before starting file I.O. there are some very basic things that we might have studied in school  or if we have a little background in computer science then we will have a basic idea of them already  this is a theoretical part, so maximum students among us must have heard about RAM, Random Access Memory  RAM is that memory of our computer which is a little fast in execution, that means when someone runs a code  so all the variables of that are created in RAM only  but the bad thing about RAM is that RAM is volatile, volatile means that once we close our system  so the data in RAM gets refreshed, that data is not stored permanently forever  but if we want to store any information permanently in our system, for example whenever we open the system  and we see that information, then we don't store that information in RAM, we can store it in the form of our files  there are many more different ways but we can store it in the form of a file, for example we wrote a Python code

chunks.Title: Lecture_7
chunks.text: now we don't want to close our laptop and restart the system again so that our code gets completely erased  so what we do is we store the entire Python code in the files  similarly if we download a photo in our system, so we don't want that as soon as we close our system  and restart it, our photo or videos get erased  so those videos and photos are not permanently stored in RAM, if we want to store them permanently  and make them persist, then we store them in the form of files, for example if we have a photo  it can be a PNG file, it can be a JPEG file, if there is a video, it can be a .MOV file, it can be a .MP4 file  if there is a Python file, it can be in .py, if there is a text file, it can be in .txt  so there are different files like this which are stored in our system  now these files are stored in our system's SSD or in the HDD

chunks.Title: Lecture_7
chunks.text: so if we talk about files, then Python can be used to perform different operations on a file  and these different operations, among which read and write are the major operations  that we can read the data from the file and we can rewrite the data in the file  these major operations together form the file I.O in Python  so if we talk in a very simple language, then in this chapter we are going to learn  how can we open a file, how can we read data from a file, how can we write some data to a file  how can we close a file and at the end how can we delete a file  now first of all let's see the types of files, all the files can be divided into two types  one is our text files, text files are those files in which the data is stored in the form of characters  for example, our .txt file is a text file, in which we get to see characters

chunks.text: our .docs file, which we can make our word document on Microsoft docs  that is a text file, .log which are the logs of our system, are stored in such files  so what is this, this is also our text file  and our non-text files, in which the data is not stored in the form of characters  but it can be stored in some other format, we call them binary files  for example, .mp4, which are our video files, are also binary files  .mov, this is also an extension of our video file  .png, .jpg, what are all these files, all these are our binary files  so we can manipulate both the files, we can access both the types of files  we can form the file I.O on them using Python
